newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Polifin VCM plant shut down for repairs.
newsitem.headline: Polifin VCM plant shut down for repairs.

text.p: Plastics and chemicals group Polifin said on Wednesday the VCM (vinyl chloride monomer) plant at its Midland factory had been shut down due to a condenser failure on October 28.
It said in a statement the plant has been shut down and the condensor is undergoing urgent repairs. It is expected that this work will take two weeks to complete," the company said in a statement.
Polifin CEO Trevor Munday said the group had attempted to procure a replacement condenser from the manufacturer and from operators of similar plants elsewhere in the world.
Searches had also been initiated at specific plant sites in South Africa, in an attempt to locate a similar piece of equipment.
The company had ordered supplementary tonnages of imported PVC (poly vinyl chloride) as a step to alleviate any inconvenience after the plant was restarted, he added.
